content: I tried running ./tools/run-dev.py on vagrant server but got -bash: ./tools/run-dev.py: Permission denied error. I guess this was because no executable was present. But when I try running manually using python I get the following Traceback error Traceback (most recent call last): File "tools/run-dev.py", line 13, in <module> from six.moves.urllib.parse import urlunparse ImportError: No module named six.moves.urllib.parse
It sounds like you might not be in a venv, but I'd also like to see what ./tools/diagnose says.
I am not able to run the ./tools/diagnose. And you are right, I am not in the venv.
How do I enter the venv? Because I guess it should enter into the venv itself on ssh.
I did run vagrant ssh. It does not enter the virtualenv after ssh in my case.
@Robert Hönig I am facing the same problem as @Divyanshu Agarwal so shifting this to error in running server.
@Rishabh Madan sounds good, feel free to ask again here if anything is unclear.
